thread.title: You Can’t Compare ’90s Hip Hop Stars to Today’s Rappers
thread.title_full: You Can’t Compare ’90s Hip Hop Stars to Today’s Rappers

author: VH1
title: You Can’t Compare ’90s Hip Hop Stars to Today’s Rappers
text:
You Can’t Compare ’90s Hip Hop Stars to Today’s Rappers Let's stop the crazy debate. by VH1 11h ago 
By Marcus Reeves 
This schism between hip hop’s millennial and Gen X begs the question can one even compare ‘90s rappers to today’s rap stars. It has been a messy and fierce debate that usually ends with no result other than a ton of mean tweets leaving hurt feelings. The answer is emphatically no, if we really accept the hard truths about the discussion. Let’s stop the tired debate and be thankful the music is still here and that there are still eager rap stars willing to continue to push on through to the future. 
Check out this sneak peek of the first five minutes of The Breaks series premiere, where DeeVee hears the song he produced with Ahm in public for the first time and Nikki Jones jumps right into the fire on her first day as Barry Fouray’s personal assistant. The Breaks premieres TONIGHT at 9/8c on VH1!
